results.headline: Pouring His Heart Into Small-Town Music Teaching
results.summary_short: Wachtang Korisheli grew up with Stalin and the Nazis, and then turned to elementary-school music teaching, in California.

results.headline: A Romanian Family, on Its Own
results.summary_short: “Waiting for August” is a child’s-eye view of one family — among many in today’s Romanian economy — rising to the challenge of living without parents.

results.headline: Monster Without a Gimmick
results.summary_short: In “The Pact 2,” a woman who cleans up crime scenes for a living finds herself pursued by a malevolent spirit.

results.headline: Back Home Again, and Little Has Changed
results.summary_short: In “The Judge,” family dynamics become more strained after a lawyer returns home for his mother’s funeral.

results.headline: Out of the Way and Haunted
results.summary_short: In “The Houses October Built,” friends hope for a scare when they go on a Halloween house road trip.

results.headline: Scenes From a Marriage, in Grief and Broken

results.summary_short: “The Canal,” starring Rupert Evans, is an Irish horror story.

results.headline: Road Rage as Aphrodisiac
results.summary_short: “Stuck” centers on a couple who meet at a bar, spend the night together and then endure being caught in a morning traffic jam.

results.headline: Why Everyone Wants to Direct
results.summary_short: In “Catch Hell,” Ryan Phillippe plays a young actor who is kidnapped when he goes to Louisiana to shoot a movie.

results.headline: A Bumpy Boyhood Before a Crescendo to Fame
results.summary_short: The life story of Paul Potts, the amateur opera singer whose big moment came on TV’s “Britain’s Got Talent.”

results.headline: Be Careful What You Wish For

results.headline: A Glimpse of Mormon Diversity
results.summary_short: “Meet the Mormons,” directed by Blair Treu, explores stereotypes about a religion with a global focus.

results.headline: Kill Your Target, Then Forget All About It
results.summary_short: India Eisley stars as an avenging killer in the film “Kite,” based on Yasuomi Umetsu’s 1998 anime.

results.headline: A Reporter in the Crosshairs
results.summary_short: “Kill the Messenger” tells the story of a real investigative reporter, Gary Webb, whose reporting about the C.I.A., the contras and drug dealers came under attack.

results.headline: In Memory, Forever Floating Like a Butterfly
results.summary_short: “I Am Ali,” a documentary about the boxing legend, covers some familiar territory but offers enticing vintage clips.

results.headline: Inside a Comedy Tour
results.summary_short: Neil Berkeley’s documentary “Harmontown” embraces the cult of personality surrounding Dan Harmon, who created the NBC sitcom “Community.”

results.headline: A Bank Robber Reflects
results.summary_short: Darius Clark Monroe directs the documentary “Evolution of a Criminal,” in which he looks at his own past.

results.headline: Whatever You Do, Don’t Drink Blood
results.summary_short: Gary Shore’s “Dracula Untold” is an origin story, recasting Prince Vlad (the Impaler) as an antihero.

results.headline: Not Just Nazis, but Undead Ones
results.summary_short: The Nazi zombies return in “Dead Snow 2,” splattering gore around modern-day Norway.

results.headline: Geezer Meets Kid, and, Well, You Know
results.summary_short: Bill Murray is in full codger mode in “St. Vincent,” a comic Brooklyn tale of intergenerational friendship and complications written and directed by Theodore Melfi.
